content: multidirectional diagonal dishcloth materials size 6 or 7 needles dishcloth yarn tapestry needle terms defined increase = knit into front and back of stitch ssk = slip the 1st st as if to knit and the 2nd as if to purl put tip of left needle into slipped stitches and knit them together through the back loop instructions first triangle 2nd half of second triangle cast on 1 stitch instead of starting the row with an row 1 increase into stitch 2 sts increase start it with a decrease k1 row 2 increase into first stitch k to end 3 k2tog continue to work the decrease in sts the middle of the row as before and after making this second decrease both repeat row 2 until there are 44 stitches needles will have the same number of sts or make as wide¹ as you would like it must be an even number of stitches when 6 sts remain work as follows k1 k3tog turn k2 second triangle k3tog turn k1 row 1 increase ssk turn k2tog cut yarn & pull through last row 2 and all even-numbered row knit remaining loop row 3 increase k1 ssk turn row 5 increase k2 ssk turn row 7 increase k3 ssk turn note this pattern is a great introduction to short row continue in this manner increasing by one stitch in every odd-numbered row between the increase and the ssk you won t need to ¹ wide = the bottom edge of the cloth in count because you will always be ssk-ing the above photo the two stitches on either side of the gap that forms from your turn on the previous row this pattern is an adaptation to the multidirectional diagonal scarf found at http //douma net/karen/knitting/accessory- work until you have half of your scarves/multidirectional_diagonal_scarf htm stitches on your right needle and half © 2003 karen baumer - permission to redistribute remain on the left needle 22 stitches granted provided that this copyright notice is on each needle included © lotzastitches may 2007 for free distribution only http //lotzastitches blogspot com/
